		<description><img width="680" height="454" src="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2016/05/shutterstock_315011135.jpg?w=680" class="attachment-large size-large wp-post-image" alt="shutterstock apple shanghai china" />&nbsp;Apple made the bombshell announcement today that it has invested $1 billion in China&#8217;s top ride hailing app. Didi Chuxing (formerly called Didi Kuaidi) is often described in U.S. media as Uber&#8217;s Chinese rival, but it already dominates the market by far. The company claims it fulfilled one billion rides last year and holds 87 percent of the country&#8217;s private ride-hailing market. <a href="http://techcrunch.com/2016/05/12/apple-invests-1b-in-didi-chuxing-chinas-largest-ride-hailing-app/?ncid=rss">Read More</a><div class="feedflare">

		<comments>http://techcrunch.com/2016/05/12/fender-headphones/#respond</comments>

The iOS app analyzes your camera roll and uses computer vision to tag your images and rank your photos by how good they are. <a href="http://techcrunch.com/2016/05/12/eyeem-the-roll/?ncid=rss">Read More</a><div class="feedflare">

<media:content url="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2016/05/the_roll_social_media.png" type="image/png" medium="image"><media:title type="html">The%20Roll%20helps%20you%20find%20the%20best%20photos%20on%20your%26nbsp%3Bphone</media:title></media:content>

			<media:title type="html">The_Roll_social_media</media:title>
		</media:content>

		<media:content url="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/f6ffdc4504715913427057be65524d44?s=96&d=identicon&r=G" medium="image">
			<media:title type="html">hajejan</media:title>
		</media:content>

		<media:content url="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2016/05/kitty.jpg" medium="image">
			<media:title type="html">The Roll's keywording is uncannily good</media:title>
		</media:content>

		<media:content url="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2016/05/jpeg-image-30af1c7c11f7-1.jpeg?w=738" medium="image">
			<media:title type="html">With a quality score of 98%, this photo I took in Tuscany five years ago was the best photo I had on my phone. Which isn't a bad shout; personally, I prefer the edited version which has a bit more contrast and saturation and is cropped slightly, but that version received a 92% score. </media:title>
		</media:content>

		<media:content url="https://tctechcrunch2011.files.wordpress.com/2016/05/theroll_group.png?w=169" medium="image">
			<media:title type="html">In addition to helping you tag and find images, the app can help you clear out your camera roll by identifying similar photographs, showing you the best ones, and removing inferior near-duplicates. </media:title>
		</media:content>
